did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Materials from work leading COLAGE at Belle Sherman Elementary School in Ithaca, NY, 1994-2006, while working as a special education teacher there.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Special education teacher at Ithaca's Belle Sherman Elementary School, September 1992- June 2006. Started COLAGE about 1994 and continued thru 2006. Social worker at Fall Creek School, Harriet Alpert, ran a Colage group there and they had a joint event once or twice. Sanders co-led Colage with Duane Diviney and Renee Swatzky (check spelling in current BS staff directory).

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Materials from work leading COLAGE at Belle Sherman Elementary School in Ithaca, NY, 1994-2006, while working as a special education teacher there.

Multimedia materials on the subjects of sexual and gender diversity among young people and families, including: “The GLSEN Lunchbox: A comprehensive training program for ending anti-gay bias in schools” - a kit in a red plastic lunch box, produced by http://www.glsen.org/; “In My Shoes: Stories of Youth with LGBT Parents,” Jen Gilomen 2005, DVD produced by COLAGE, with study guide; Judy Shepard PSA Network Version VHS; “Speaking for Ourselves: Portraits of Gay and Lesbian Youths,” Diversity Productions, Seattle, VHS, 27 min; “Both of my Moms' Names are Judy: Children of Lesbians and Gays Speak Out,” Lesbian and Gay Parents Association, 1994, VHS, 10:16 min; “Gay Pioneers: July 4, 1965, Independence Hall,” Equality Forum, DVD - Glenn Holsten, Director, Malcolm Lazin, Exec. Producer.

controlaccess.head: Places:
controlaccess.geogname: Belle Sherman Elementary School -- Ithaca, NY.
